page.title: 17TRADE:COOKSTOWN STREET MARTS
page.content: Market day in Cookstown is Saturday.This originated from a charter granted in the reigh of Charles I confering the right to hold a market. Every Saturday traders come from all over the province and set up their stalls along both sides of the main street.They sell a great variety of items.While clothing and fabrics dominate there are also hardware,fruit and vegetables,jewellery including watches,electrical goods,eggs,footwear and carpets. This market attracks a great many people into the town and as Saturday is also an important livestock sales day families will come in from a wide radius.The main problem arising from this is car parking,the official car parks being quiet inadequate and quiet serious conjestion arises.
